Description: Provide people with the ability to authorize your apps and websites that access information about them on Apple REST services, like Roster API.
Download App Store information and app-install activity on behalf of your app’s users.
Support In-App Purchases through the App Store for exceptionally large catalogs of custom one-time purchases, subscriptions, and subscriptions with optional add-ons.
Download App Store information and app-install activity about your app.
Automate the tasks you perform on the Apple Developer website and in App Store Connect.
Monitor In-App Purchase events in real time and learn of unreported external purchase tokens, with server notifications from the App Store.
NOTE: The App Store Server Notifications V1 endpoint and version 1 notifications, notification_type, are deprecated. Implement the App Store Server Notifications V2 endpoint on your server to receive version 2 notifications instead.

Description: Drive app discovery by creating and managing campaigns with the Apple Ads Campaign Management API.
Reduce API calls and conserve device power by streamlining your app’s georelated searches.
Integrate streaming music with catalog and personal content.
Access the content of the Apple Music Catalog in bulk.
Design, create, and publish signature content for Apple News.
API: Apple News API 1.0+, Apple News Format 1.7+

Service: Apple Pay Merchant Token Management API
Description: Retrieve and manage payment life-cycle events for your Apple Pay merchant tokens.

Service: Apple Pay Web Merchant Registration API
Description: Manage merchant registration through your web platform.
API: Apple Pay Web Merchant Registration API 1.0+

Description: Manage sign-in tokens from your web server that facilitate single sign-on across the devices of your media-streaming service customers.
Declare the activities supported by your educational app through a web interface.
Manage your organization’s devices remotely.
API: Device Assignment Services 5.0+, VPP License Management 1.0+
OS: iOS 13.0+, iPadOS 13.0+, macOS 10.15+, tvOS 13.0+, visionOS 1.1+, watchOS 6.0+

Description: Send and manage reports you send to Apple for tokens you receive when your app provides external purchases for digital goods and services.
Convert iWork documents to Portable Document Format (PDF) files using a web API.
Create a static image of a map from a URL.
Submit your macOS software for notarization through a web interface.
Provide a reason for customers to stay subscribed with a preconfigured message that you can choose in real time, appropriate to the product and locale.
Read information about people and classes from an Apple School Manager organization.
Provide users the ability to sign in to your apps and websites using their Apple Account.
API: Sign in with Apple JS 1.0+, Sign in with Apple REST API 1.0+

Description: Update users’ calendars and inform suggestions from Siri with reservation data embedded in email and webpages.
Stream music directly to HomePod speakers from your media service.
Attribute app-install campaigns that originate on the web.
Obtain historical, current, and predictive weather for your app or service.
NOTE: Using this API requires attribution. See WeatherKit - Data Sources to learn more.
